title: Airlines are Struggling To Stay Afloat Amid The Pandemic
summary: Investors were particularly worried about Asian carriers, which had already been hurting because of the strong U.S. dollar and global economic slowdown. Asian airlines have borne the brunt of the pandemic, but the impact has also been significant in North America and Europe. The pandemic has also taken a toll on Cathay Pacific’s bottom line. Fortunately, the airline industry has been able to capitalize on other carriers’ cancellations and re-routings by providing them with additional seats on its planes.
